intro: Hippocratea grisebachii var. typica, commonly known as the typical grisebach hippocratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
